Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which was found at Oxyrhynchus (P.Oxy. VIII 123) and which dates from the year 158/159 B.C, contains a contract between a man named Apion, son of Sarapion, who undertakes to regain the running of pieces of the imperial domain, and the heiress of the deceased keeper of the other pieces.
